Instance Methods

addAsync(f : Void -> Void, ?timeout : Int) : Void -> Void

parameters:
f, the function that is called asynchrnously
timeout, the maximum time to wait for f() (default is 250)
returns:
returns a function closure that must be executed asynchrnously
Adds a function that is called asynchronously. Example: 
	 var fixture = new TestFixture(new TestClass(), "test");
	 var handler = new TestHandler(fixture);
	 var flag = false;
	 var async = handler.addAsync(function() {
	   flag = true;
	 }, 50);
	 handler.onTimeout.add(function(h) {
	   trace("TIMEOUT");
	 });
	 handler.onTested.add(function(h) {
	   trace(flag ? "OK" : "FAILED");
	 });
	 haxe.Timer.delay(function() async(), 10);
	 handler.execute();

addEvent<EventArg>(f : EventArg -> Void, ?timeout : Int) : e : EventArg -> Void

execute() : Void

setTimeout(timeout : Int) : Void
